summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 FORD F-350 EQUIPPED WITH BCT HI-RUN TIRES, SIZE L235/85R16 (NA). WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 65 MPH, THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE TIRE BLEW OUT. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT THE TIRE TREADS WERE SEPARATING FROM THE TIRES AND THE TIRES NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. WHILE AT THE INDEPENDENT MECHANIC, THE OTHER THREE TIRES BLEW OUT. THE TIRES WERE NOT REPAIRED. THE TIRES WERE NOT ORIGINAL EQUIPMENT. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURES. THE APPROXIMATE VEHICLE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 190,000 AND THE TIRE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 4,000. THE VIN AND DOT NUMBER WERE NOT PROVIDED.

HAD BOTH OF MY STEER TIRES BLOW OUT GOING DOWN THE HIGH WAY RIGHT SIDE I HAD A TRAILER ON AND THE OTHER I HAD JUST GOT ON TO THE INTERSTATE. PUT A HOLE IN MY FLOOR ON DRIVERSIDE AND BROKE THE BRAKE LINE ON THE DRIVERSIDE AS WELL. PASSENGER SIDE JUST LET LOOSE WITH NO WARNING. I STILL HAVE ALL FOUR TIRES AND THE TREAD. THESE WERE 235/85R16

MY FORD F350 CREWCAB CAUGHT ON FIRE FOR NO APPARENT REASON. I AM JUST NOW FINDING OUT THAT THERE IS A RECALL ON MY VEHICLE BECAUSE OF SPONTANEOUS FIRES ON MY YEAR AND MODEL. I SPENT ALMOST $3000.00 ON REPAIRS AND HAVE BEEN HAVING ONGOING PROBLEMS WITH THE ENGINE QUITTING WHILE DRIVING. I WOULD LIKE TO KNOW IF THERE IS ANY REMEDY THAT I CAN OBTAIN FROM FORD. I HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE TO USE THIS TRUCK FOR OVER 2 YEARS BECAUSE OF THE ENGINE QUITTING AND THEN A NO START SITUATION. VEHICLE WILL START AFTER IT COOLS DOWN BUT WILL STOP WITHIN A HALF HOUR.THIS IS FRUSTRATING BECAUSE THIS IS MY ONLY VEHICLE AND I HAVE LOST USE OF THE TRUCK AND HAD TO STOP WORKING BECAUSE I AM A CONSTRUCTION CONTRACTOR AND NEEDED IT TO WORK. I HAVE HAD THE TRUCK TO THE DEALER NUMEROUS TIMES. AFTER RESEARCHING PROBLEMS ONLINE I HAD ONLY FOUND OUT THEN ABOUT POSSIBLE UNDERHOOD FIRES ON MY VEHICLE. I ALSO FOUND OUT ABOUT OTHER TSB AND RECALL INFORMATION OF WHICH I HAD NOT BEEN NOTIFIED. *TR

1993 FORD F-350 WITH A 5.8 ENGINE, I RECEIVED THIS INFO. FROM ALLDATA. I READ ON FORD'S WEB SITE THAT A SAFETY RECALL GENERALLY NEVER EXPIRES... RECALL #'S 00S57 FUEL PRESSURE REGULATOR REPLACEMENT, # 00V424000 FUEL PRESSURE REGULATOR MALFUNCTION, # 01L008000 FUEL PUMP CHECK VALVE DEFECT., ALL THREE OF THESE HAVE THE SAME SYMPTOMS, CAUSES FUEL FROM THE REAR TANK TO TRANSFER TO THE FRONT TANK AND CAUSE FUEL TO RUN OUT OF THE FUEL FILLER NECK OF THE FRONT TANK AND DOWN THE SIDE OF THE TRUCK ONTO THE GROUND. I HAVE OWNED THE TRUCK FOR 6 YEARS AND HAVE NEVER RECEIVED ANY TYPE OF NOTICE FOR THIS, ONE NOTICE STATES THAT VEHICLE OWNERS WOULD BE NOTIFIED STARTING MAY 2001, FORD SENT ME AN EMAIL TODAY STATING THAT THEY WOULD NOT REPAIR THIS, I EVEN SENT THEM THE RECALL #'S, I HOPE THAT YOU CAN OFFER ME SOME HELP ON THIS, AS I REALLY DO NOT WANT MY TRUCK TO CATCH FIRE WITH OR WITHOUT MY FAMILY IN IT.  THANK YOU *TR  UPDATED 03/06/09. *JB

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 FORD F350.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE  PARKING BRAKE SYSTEM WAS INEFFECTIVE.  THE PARKING BRAKE DOES NOT HOLD THE VEHICLE AND CAUSES IT TO ROLL FREELY.  HE TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER ON TWO OCCASIONS AND THEY REPLACED THE BRAKE CABLES TWICE AT THE COST OF $300 EACH.  WHEN THE FAILURE RESURFACED, THE CONTACT CALLED THE MANUFACTURER IN REFERENCE TO NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 94V169001 (PARKING BRAKE:CONVENTIONAL) AND WAS INFORMED THAT HIS VIN WAS NOT INCLUDED IN THE RECALL.  THE CONTACT WOULD BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE REPAIRS.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 45,000 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 202,000.

WE OWN A 1993 FORD F350.  IT WAS PARKED IN FRONT OF OUR HOUSE ATTACHED GARAGE.  IT WAS NOT RUNNING.  MY HUSBAND WENT OUTSIDE AND WALKED BETWEEN THE TRUCK AND GARAGE.  HE SMELLED SMOKE, LOOKED TOWARD THE PICKUP AND SAW SMOKE COMING OUT FROM UNDER THE HOOD.  HE QUICKLY RAISED THE HOOD AND PUT THE FIRE OUT.  OUR CRUISE CONTROL HAD NOT BEEN WORKING FOR SOME TIME.  MY HUSBAND PURCHASED THE SWITCH FROM CANTON MOTORS AND REPLACED IT.  THE CRUISE CONTROL WORKED AGAIN, FOR AWHILE.  IT HAS NOT CAUGHT ON FIRE AGAIN, YET BUT I'M AFRAID WE HAVE ANOTHER DEFECTIVE SWITCH. FORD HAS A RECALL ON 1993 PICKUPS NOW FOR THAT PROBLEM BUT WHEN I CHECKED OUR VIN,  IT STATES THERE IS NO RECALL ON IT.  I BELIEVE THAT FORD SHOULD REIMBURSE US FOR THE SWITCH WE PURCHASED AND REPLACE IT. THE FIRST SWITCH IS POSSIBLY AVAILABLE.  THE CURRENT ONE IS STILL ON THE PICKUP.  I TALKED TO FORD CUSTOMER SERVICE TO RESOLVE THIS PROBLEM BUT NO HELP WAS OFFERED AND THE LADY WAS RATHER RUDE.  I DO NOT REMEMBER THE DATE OF THE FIRE.  THE CRUISE CONTROL DOES NOT WORK NOW.  *TR

DT*:  THE CONTACT STATED WHILE DRIVING 60 MPH ON THE INTERSTATE IN NORMAL ROAD CONDITIONS, THE LEFT INNER DUALLY TIRE TREAD SEPARATED WITHOUT WARNING.  THE CONTACT MANAGED TO PULL OVER WITHOUT INCIDENT.  UPON INITIAL INSPECTION, THE CARCASS OF THE TIRE REMAINED INFLATED, YET THE TREAD WAS COMPLETELY SEPARATED.  THERE WAS DAMAGE TO THE FUEL LINES FROM THE INITIAL TIRE TREAD SEPARATION.  THERE WERE NO OBVIOUS ROAD HAZARD OR DEBRIS.  THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT ALERTED.  THE TIRE WAS A BRIDGESTONE LT 215/85/R16, LOAD RANGE E.     UPDATED 03/30/07. *JB

I WAS USING MY REAR GAS TANK IN MY DUAL TANK SYSTEM. THE FUEL ,IN ADDITION TO OPERATING THE VEHICLE, PUMPED INTO THE HALF FULL FRONT TANK. WHEN I WENT TO FILL THE FRONT TANK AT THE FILLING STATION, THE FUEL FORCIBLY SPILLED OUT OF THE FRONT TANK, SPRAYING ON ME.  *NM

TIRE TREAD SEPARATION ON LOW MILEAGE TIRE.  TIRE MODEL  WILD COUNTRY APT LT235/85R-16.  MILEAGE VERIFIED AT 21,152MI.  VEHICAL DAMAGE DUE TO TIRE TREAD IMPACTING AUTO AND BRAKE LINES.    NO INJURIES.  TIRE WAS A REAR TIRE, SO WE HAD TO REPLACE BOTH TIRES.

CLUTCH SLAVE CYLINDER TOO CLOSE TO EXHAUST AND OVER HEATS O-RING CAUSING LOSS OF BRAKE FLUID AND LOSS OF CLUTCH.  LESS THAN 50,000 MILES ON TRUCK AND IS USED FOR TOWING 5TH WHEEL RV SOME TIMES IN MOUNTAINS IT HAS WENT OUT TWO TIMES NOW ONCE ABOUT TWO YEARS AGO AND JUST TODAY, 08/17/2005. HEAT INSULATOR WAS IN PLACE BOTH TIMES. *JB

WHILE DRIVING THE SERPENTINE BELT SNAPPED OFF. THIS CAUSED THE VEHICLE TO LOSE POWER AND EXTENDED STOPPING DISTANCE. THE DEALERSHIP WAS NOTIFIED, BUT DID NOT RESOLVE PROBLEM. THE CAUSE WAS NOT DETERMINED. PLEASE PROVIDE MORE INFORMATION.  *NM
WHILE VEHICLE WAS PARKED A FIRE STARTED UNDER THE HOOD.  DEALERSHIP WAS NOTIFIED, BUT DID NOT RESOLVE THE PROBLEM. *AK
THE CLUTCH GOT STUCK IN  DRIVE. CONSUMER HAD TO APPLY THE BRAKES IN ORDER TO STOP THE VEHICLE.  CONSUMER WAS NOT ABLE TO REMOVE THE GEAR, AND THE VEHICLE IS IN THE SHOP FOR T REPAIRS. *AK

EXHAUST FUMES  WERE LEAKING INTO THE CAB OF THE VEHICLE. CONSUMER CONTACTED THE DEALER, WHO DIDN'T THINK THAT THIS PROBLEM WAS IMPORTANT, AND WILL NOT SERVICE VEHICLE IN A TIMELY MANOR. ALSO,  CONSUMER ASKED FOR  MANUFACTURER'S TELEPHONE NUMBER, BUT  THE DEALER REFUSED TO COOPERATE.  *AK

SERPENTINE BELT DETACHES FROM TENSION PULLEY AND/OR IDLER PULLEY. DETACHED BELT CAUSES DAMAGE TO TRANSMISSION COOLER LINES, RADIATOR LINES, AND BREAKS IDLER PULLEY FROM BRACKET.  POWER STEERING AND BRAKING ARE LOST MAKING VEHICLE VERY DIFFICULT TO CONTROL. FLYING IDLER PULLEY MAY CAUSE ADDITIONAL DAMAGE AND/OR FALLS TO ROADWAY AS HAZARD.  DAMAGE TO TRANSMISSION LINES MAY CAUSE FIRE.  CAUSED BY UNEVEN WEAR TO THE PLASTIC BELT TENSIONER PULLEY.  PLASTIC PULLEY DEFORMS IN SUCH A MANNER THAT THE SERPENTINE BELT TRAVELS FORWARD (TOWARD FAN) AND OFF OF PULLEY.  A SIMILAR DEFECT (NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER 96I003000) WAS REMEDIED WITH A VOLUNTARY RECALL BY FORD IN 1996.  THIS PARTICULAR VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED TO THAT STANDARD.  THE STANDARD APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN INADEQUATE. *AK
WHEN THE VEHICLE  IDLED  CONSUMER SMELLED AND HEARD EXHAUST LEAKING.   DEALER EXAMINED THE VEHICLE, AND FOUND THAT THE EXHAUST GAS RECIRCULATION TUBE (EGR) HAD A HOLE IN IT.  *AK
THE REAR BRAKES LOCKED UP, WHEN THEY WERE PRESSED.       *JB

CLUTCH MASTER CYLINDER, PUSH ROD PLASTIC EXTENSION FRACTURED AND BROKE WHILE VEHICLE WAS IN MOTION ON THE HIGHWAY.  THE VEHICLE WAS UNABLE TO BE SHIFTED OUT OF GEAR AND WAS UNABLE TO STOP FORWARD MOTION UNTIL THE ENGINE WAS STOPPED.  WITH FURTHER INSPECTION OF THE COMPONENT I WAS ABLE TO DETERMINE THAT WEAR AND LUBRICATIONS WILL CAUSE THIS FAILURE.  AN ENTIRE ALL METAL UNIT SHOULD REPLACE THIS COMPONENT.  VEHICLE WAS AT 150,000 MILES WHEN FAILURE OCCURRED.*JB

WHEN VEHICLE IS BEING DRIVEN THE BELT TENSIONER KEEPS SHREDDING SERPENTINE BELT, CAUSING VEHICLES ENGINE TO DIED. IN ONE CASE THE BELT TENSION SHIERD OFF,  SENDING A METAL BOLT FROM ENGINE THAT PUNCTURED RADIATOR FAN.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER INFORMATION.   MR

WHILE DRIVING CONSUMER TRIED TO PUSH CLUTCH IN THE BUSHING BROKE, AND THE LINKAGE FELL APART, MAKING CLUTCH INOPERATIVE.  *AKCONSUMER HAD NOT FOLLOWED UP ON THE FINAL RESPONSE TO THE COMPLAINT FILED VIA TELEPHONE BECAUSE THE VEHICLE BROKE DOWN 800 MILES FROM HIS HOME.  CONSUMER FEELS A RECALL SHOULD BE ISSUED TO REPAIR THIS PROBLEM.  THE FAILURE TO COMSUMERS VEHICLE WAS DUE TO A PUSH ROD MAST.  *JG
VEHICLE WOULD INTERMITTENTLY STALL WHILE DRIVING. VEHICLE BEEN IN  DEALER SHOP ON TWO OCCASIONS, AND THE PROBLEM STILL REOCCURRING. FEEL FREE TO PROVIDE ANY FURTHER INFORMATION ON THIS MATTER.*AK

WHILE DRIVING AT APPROXIMATELY 10 MPH FORD, F350, SUPERDUTY TRUCK SUDDENLY VEERED OFF OF THE ROAD TO  RIGHT AND HIT A TELEPHONE POLE, CAUSING $6,000.00 DAMAGE TO VEHICLE.   DEALER EXAMINED VEHICL, AND DETERMINED THAT LOWER STEERING SHAFT BROKE, CAUSING LOSS OF CONTROL.   PLEASE PROVIDE ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION/ATTACHMENTS.*AK

STEERING GEAR BOX CAUSED RIVITS ON CROSS MEMBER OF FRAME TO STRETCH, ALSO CAUSING A SNAPPING NOISE IN FRONT END, ON CLOSER INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND THAT CROSS MEMBER OF FRAME AT STEERING BOX WAS LOOSE, FORD WOULD NOT SHARE IN REPAIR COST DUE TO VEHICLE BEING OUT OF WARRANTY.   *SLC

CONSUMER  RECEIVED RECALL NOTICE FOR CAMPAIGN 00V424000 IN  MAIL.  WHEN CONTACTING  DEALERSHIP, WAS INFORMED THAT VEHICLE WOULD NOT BE REPAIRED UNLESS HE WAS EXPERIENCING THIS PROBLEM.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION/ATTACHMENTS.*AK
REAR SEAT BELTS FAILED TO FUNCTION ON RESTRAINT. *AK

RECALL 93 V 125 000/FUEL TANK ASSEMBLY: A PORTION OF THE UNUSED FUEL FROM ONE TANK TO BE RETURNED TO THE SECOND TANK, WHEN THIS OCCURRED,  SECOND TANK EXCEEDED, CAUSING FUEL SPILLAGES. SPILL CAN RESULT IN A FIRE WHEN EXPOSED TO A SOURCE OF IGNITION;.MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED, AND INFORMED THAT RECALL REPAIRS WAS COMPLETED ON THAT VEHICLE, AND NO OTHER REPAIRS WOULD BE MADE.  FEEL FREE TO PROVIDE ANY FURTHER DETAILS ON THIS MATTER . *AK

ENGIE CHECK LIGHT COMES ON FOR REAR TANK. GAS LEAKS FROM  GAS LINE WHERE  NOZZLE IS INSERTED. WHEN BOTH TANKS ARE FULL  SWITCH VALVE CAUSES  VEHICLE TO ALMOST STALL. ALSO, WHEN THEY ARE FULL THEY MAKE A LOUD HUMMING NOISE ONCE GAS BURNS OUT  NOISE GRADUALLY GOES AWAY.*AK
WHEN  BRAKES  ARE APPLIED  FRONT DISC BRAKES LOCK UP, CREATING EXTREME VIBRATION WHICH RESULTS IN LOSS OF STEERING CONTROL. *AK
REPEATED FAILURE OF ALL DISC BRAKE COMPONENTS (RUBBER, CYLINDERS, ETC.) 18,000 MILES AND AGAIN AT 49,000 MILES.  *AK

WHEN  SWITCHING FROM ONE TANK TO SECOND FUEL TANK FUEL IS NOT BEING PUMPED TO ENGINE OF VEHICLE.  MANUFACTURER INFORMED CONSUMER  THATR THIS VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED IN ANY RECALL.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION/ATTACHMENTS.*AK

THIS TRUCK HAS TWO TANKS. WHEN DRIVING  RESERVE TANK PUSHES ALL  FUEL INTO  FRONT TANK, CAUSING AN OVERFLOW. DEALER HAS BEEN CONTACTED. THERE  IS A RECALL, BUT THIS VEHICLE  WAS  NOT COVERED.*AK  CONSUMER STATES THIS PROBLEM HAS BEEN CONTINUOUS FOR ABOUT 2 YEARS.   *SLC
WHILE TRAVELING OR MAKING STOPS NOTICED GAS SMELL INSIDE VEHICLE.  DEALER HAS BEEN CONTACTED.  *AK  DEALER INDICATED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS NOT ON RECALL.  *YH
FIRESTONE STEELTEX RADIAL AT TIRE (P235/85R16) EXPERIENCED SIDEWALL SEPARATION.   *SLC
DRIVER'S SIDE TIRE TREAD SEPARATED.  *AK  BOTH STEEL TEX R4S TIRES HAD TREAD SEPARATED WHILE TRAVELING.  *YH

ON 9/27/2000, I HAD THE ANNUAL VEHICLE INSPECTION IN ACCORDANCE WITH VIRGINIA STATE LAW.  AT THAT TIME, THE INSPECTOR BROUGHT TO MY ATTENTION THAT 4 OF THE SIX TIRES HAD CRACKING IN THE AREA WHERE TREAD SEPARATION WOULD NORMALLY OCCUR.  I USE THIS VEHICLE NORMALLY TO PULL MY FIFTH WHEEL RECREATION VEHICLE.  OBVIOUSLY, THE TIRE CRACKING GAVE ME MUCH CONCERN.  TODAY, 10/10/200, I HAD ALL FIRESTONE TIRES REPLACED.  FURTHER INSPECTION INDICATED THAT ALL TIRES SHOW SOME INDICATION OF CRACKING. (DOT NUMBER: VNOP1WV053  TIRESIZE: LT21585R16)

RIGHT FRONT TIRE BLEWOUT WHILE DRIVING, THE PLIES SEPARATED AND THE TIRE IMMEDIATELY DISINTEGRATED CAUSING LOSS OF CONTROL, NOY ONLY DUE TO THE TIRE BUT BECAUSE THE AUTOMATIC FUEL PUMP SHUT OFF SWITCH WAS ACTIVATED BECAUSE OF THE VIBRATION FROM THE BLOWN TIRE (MICHELIN XCH-4 LT 225/75R16).  NLM

PE00020, ORIGINAL EQUIPMENT ON 1993 FORD F350, TIRE SIZE LT23585R16. FRONT PASSENGER'S TIRE AND THE REAR DRIVER'S TIRE TREAD CAME APART WHICH CAUSED TIRE TO EXPLODE, ALMOST RESULTING IN A CRASH.  *AK  TWO TIRES SEPERATED AND EXPLODED.  SEPERATE INCIDENTS APPROXIMATELY 6-12 MONTHS APART.  *YH
TREAD BECAME COMPLETELY REMOVED FROM THE TIRE WITHOUT LOOSING ANY AIR.  THE TIRE REMAINED INFLATED BUT WITHOUT THE TREAD.*AK( DOT NUMBER:   TIRE SIZE: LT24575R16 )

WHILE DRIVING ABOUT 60 MPH LEFT REAR TIRE TREAD SEPARATED, BUT, CONSUMER KEPT CONTROL OF VEHICLE.  FIRESTONE AT TIRES.  *AK  ON SECOND OCCASION RIGHT REAR TIRE TREAD SEPARATED WHILE DRIVING AT 55 MPH.  *YH
WHILE DRIVING  AND  STEPPING ON THE CLUTCH TO REDUCE SPEED,  CLUTCH BROKE DOWN, AND THE PEDAL WENT TO THE FLOOR WITHOUT A PRIOR WARNING. *AK
WHILE DRIVING FUEL COULD PASS FROM ONE TANK TO THE OTHER, FORCING A FUEL SPILLAGE.  CONSUMER IS AFRAID OF A WORSE SITUATION.  *AK
WHEN  BRAKES ARE APPLIED THEY  PULSATE.   DEALER HAS INFORMED THE CONSUMER THAT THE BRAKE SYSTEM HAS DRY ROTTED AND NEEDED TO BE REPLACED.  *AK

WHILE DRIVING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD, PULLED UP TO A STOP SIGN, PUSHED THE CLUTCH IN,  PUSH ROD ASSEMBLY BROKE AND MADE THE VEHICLE LURCH FORWARD .   WHEN THIS HAPPENED,CONSUMER HAD NO CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE. THE ONLY WAY TO STOP THE VEHICLE WAS TO KILL THE ENGINE.  CONTACTED THE DEALER, THEY WANTED 90.12 FOR THE WHOLE MASTER CYLINDER. BUT DID NOT NEED THE WHOLE ASSEMBLY FIXED, JUST THE PUSH ROD. THE NEW KIT COMES WITH A METAL ROD AND THE FACTORY PART HAS A PLASTIC PIECE THAT CRACKS.  *AK

FRONT FUEL TANK BEING FILLED WHEN BACK TANK IS BEING USED. FORD SAYS IT MIGHT BE THE FUEL PRESSURE REGULATOR AND CHECK VALVES. WE FOUND A RECALL ON F-350'S 90,91,92 AND SOME 93 MODELS #93V125000. AND FORD SAYS IT'S NOT ON THEIR CAMPAIGN MESSAGE. WOULD LIKE SOME HELP IN THIS PROBLEM.

FORWARD PLANETARY IN AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION MADE OF ALUMINUM--- THE CENTER SPLINES STRIPPED OUT FOR THE THIRD TIME   --   FINALLY FOUND ALL STEEL AFTER MARKET REPLACEMENT   -- ASSEMBLY SHOULD HAVE BEEN STRONGER TO BEGIN WITH   -- OTHERS MUST BE HAVING THE SAME  PROBLEM OR NO ONE WOULD HAVE NEEDED TO MAKE A STRONGER AFTERMARKET REPLACEMENT

THE DRIVESHAFT CAME OFF DUE THE DEFECTIVE WELDS AND BOLTS WHICH MAY CAUSE A LOSS OF VEHICLE CONTROL.*AK WHILE AFTER 2 HRS DRIVE THE POWER STEERING FLUID HAD LEAKED OUT,ALSO DIESEL FUEL WAS LEAKING. *ET
FUEL RETURN IS LEAKING DIESEL FUEL ONTO INJECTORS AND EXHAUST, CAUSING A SERIOUS FIRE HAZARD. *AK
WHEN DRIVING AND USING THE EMERGENCY BRAKE, THE EMERGENCY BRAKE GOES ALL THE WAY TO THE FLOOR, AND CONSUMER HAS TO RESET THE EMERGENCY BRAKE.   *AK
SLAVE CYLINDER FAILED, WAS UNABLE TO DISENGAGE FROM THE CLUTCH.  *AK

components: ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,UNKNOWN OR OTHER
summary: ENGINE CHECK LIGHT CAME ON. VEHICLE PULLED OVER AND ADDED 3 GALLONS OF WATER AFTER DISCOVERING THAT THE WATER RESERVOIR CRACKED. ALSO REPLACED HEAD GASKETS. ALSO SMOKE CAME FROM EXHAUST SYSTEM INTO ENGINE COMPARTMENT.
SERPENTINE BELT CONTINUOUSLY FALLS OFF.
SERPENTINE BELT IDLER FAILED.
SERPENTINE BELT DISINTEGRATES AND FALLS OFF AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS.
ENGINE LOCKED UP DUE TO CYLINDER FAILURE.

I HAD TO STOP SUDDENLY, AND THE BRAKE PEDAL WENT TO THE FLOOR, AND DIDN'T SLOW THE VEHICLE DOWN.  I SWIRVED TO MISS A CAR, AND WAS SIDE SWIPED BY A TRUCK.  IF THE BRAKES WOULD HAVE WORKED PROPERLY, THE ACCIDENT WOULD HAVE BEEN AVOIDABLE.
THE CLUTCH ROD  MADE OUT OF PLASTIC, CAUSED THE CLUTCH TO BREAK AND DISABLED THE CLUTCH, CAUSING THE TRUCK NOT TO BE ABLE TO STOP.  *AK

WHEN APPLYING THE BRAKES AND THEN RELEASING THE BRAKES, A FEW SECONDS LATER, THE CALIPERS HAVE BURNED UP. THEN THERE ARE  NO BRAKES. HAS BEEN HAPPENING FOR 3 YEARS. DEALER HAS REPLACED THE WHOLE BRAKE SYSTEM, STILL NO SOLUTION TO PROBLEM.  *AK
MASTER CYLINDER FAILED SEVERAL TIMES.
HARSH SHIFTING OF TRANSMISSION.
WHILE STOPPED AT RAILROAD CROSSING, DRIVER NOTED SMOKE COMING FROM THE INSTRUMENT PANE.  AS SHE GUIDED CHILDREN OUT OF VEHICLE HOT PLASTIC AND FIRE DROPPED ONTO HER FEET.
FUEL INTAKE SYSTEM WILL NOT ACCEPT FUEL CAUSING FUEL TO LEAK OUT WHILE FILLING TRUCK WITH GAS
WHILE DRIVING VEHICLE ABOUT 40-55MPH LOST CONTROL DUE TO THE STRETCHING OR DETACHMENT OF THE SERPENTINE BELT AND TENSIONER PULLEY, CAUSING LOSS  OF POWER STEERING/BRAKES.  *AK
I-BEAM BOLT CAME COMPLETELY OUT IN THE RIGHT FRONT STEERING ASSEMBLY.

THE SPRING LOADED IDLER TIGHTENER BRACKET ON THE FRONT OF THE MOTOR BECOMES UNALIGNED, CAUSING THE SERPENTINE BELT TO COME OFF. WHEN THIS HAPPENS  LOSES  STEERING AND BRAKES. FORD HAS REPLACED THIS PART (2) DIFFERENT TIMES, WHICH HAS NOT CORRECTED THE PROBLEM.
SLAVE CYLINDER FAILED, DRIVER ALMOST HAD AN ACCIDENT DUE TO BEING UNABLE TO DISENGAGE FROM CLUTCH GEAR.
OWNER STATES THAT WHILE DRIVING THE CLUTCH SLAVE CYLINDER GOES OUT.  THIS IS 5TH TIME PROBLEM HAS OCCURRED.  CAUSE IS UNDETERMINED. OWNER IS VERY CONCERNED FOR SAFETY.   *AK

OWNER HAS ABS BRAKES,  HE STATES THAT HIS BRAKES WEAR DOWN IN THE REAR WHICH CAUSES THE BRAKES TO BECOME WARPED,  HE ALSO NOTES THAT VEHICLE DOES NOT WANT TO STOP WHEN BRAKES ARE USED. HE DISCONNECTED THE ABS SYSTEM AND VEHICLE RUNS BETTER.   *AK
FRONT BRAKES FAIL TO RELEASE, CAUSING VEHICLE TO PULL TO THE RIGHT.
WHEN APPLYING THE ABS BRAKES, THEY LOCK UP AND WOULDN'T RELEASE, TOOK TO DEALER AND HE SAID THST THE PISTON IN WHEEL CALIPER  WERE DEFECTIVE.  *AK
THE WIRING INSIDE THE FUEL TANK WAS BURNED OFF THE TERMINAL.  *AK
WHILE ATTEMPTING TO APPLY BRAKES, THE VEHICLE WOULD NOT STOP.   *AK
REAR BRAKES DO NOT STAY ADJUSTED, MUST BE READJUSTED EVERY 2500 MILES.
CONSUMER STATES THAT THE IGNITION SWITCH HAS BEEN REPLACED FOUR TIMES IN TWO MONTHS.   *AK
BRAKES GRABBED DURING APPLICATION, NO RESPONSE FROM ABS, RESULTING IN AN ACCIDENT.*AK
BOLT IN BELT TENSIONER BROKE, CAUSING PART TO GO INTO FAN, DISABLING VEHICLE. *SD
STEERING COLLAPSE D WHERE IT CAUSED THE WHEEL TO GO EVERYWHERE.  PLEASE GIVE MORE DETAILS.  *AK
IGNITION SWITCH FAILS INTERMITENTLY. *DSH
THE TOP BOLT ON THE LEFT REAR DOOR HINGE IS BROKEN.   *AK
